Vijayawada: Two on life support die in g.description: VIJAYAWADA: Two patients on ventilator died minutes after a power outage in Vijayawada government general hospital (GGH) on Wednesday night. The deceased were identified as Kanna Vara Prasad (22) and Sunkara Adinarayana (50), both victims of a road accident. While Vara Prasad was admitted to the hospital on June 9, Adinarayana was admitted on June 11. Both had head injuries and were put on ventilators. They died around 9:15 pm on Wednesday. Family members of the deceased and other patients in the trauma care ward alleged that the ventilators went off with the power outage and the generator was switched after ten minutes. Speaking to TOI, V Siva Ramakrishna, Vara Prasad’s maternal uncle, said that power went off in the hospital around 9:15 pm after some gusty wind. “It was total darkness in the trauma care unit and the ventilator machines also went off. We looked for the nurses and support staff but could not find them. We ran from pillar to post to request them to switch on the generator. It took them ten minutes to turn the generator on but by that time, my nephew had died,” he alleged. Relatives of Vara Prasad staged a protest at the hospital, demanding action against negligent staffers. Sunkara Adinarayana who was being treated on the adjacent bed to Vara Prasad also died at the same time. Hospital authorities gave intimation of death to the police at 9:30 pm. GGH superintendent Dr S Babulal denied the allegation that the deaths took place due to a power outage. He said that the ventilators come with an automatic power backup that lasts for six hours. “Even if there was a delay in switching on the generator, ventilators do not have any problem as they draw from the backup. The deaths took place only because of the medical condition of the patients. The timing was a mere coincidence,” he claimed. “We have 12 ventilators in the hospital and seven people are being treated on them. Of the seven, two died on Wednesday,” Babulal added. However, Siva Ramakrishna refuted the argument of hospital authorities and demanded for an inquiry to check the ventilators at the trauma care ward. He said two of three patients in the ward died when the power went off. Balakrishna, the third patient in the trauma care ward, also said that the ventilator machines went off during power outage. Siva Ramakrishna lodged a complaint with Machavaram police alleging negligence by hospital staff that caused the death of his nephew. A case has been registered. Lowering wasteful expenditure is priorit.description: Vijayawada: Finance minister Buggana Rajendranath Reddy has started the exercise to prepare his first budget, which will be presented sometime next month. Since taking charge of the crucial ministry, Buggana has been holding review meetings with all department heads to know the state’s present financial situation. “I have just started looking at the finances, and it has shocked me. The previous government completely mismanaged the state’s finances. Though the CAG had warned about the financial mismanagement, the earlier government never paid heed to it. The exchequer is now empty,” he said. The minister further alleged that while the previous government diverted funds from every account, the expenditure was mostly unwarranted. “A big portion of the state’s funds was spent on publicity and other works. Funds from various departments were pooled up and spent on tours and events,” he said, adding that he would require some more time to get to know the actual position of the state’s finances. “Many things need to be readjusted to meet the needs of all departments, and the promises made to people.” The first priority of the government is to cut down on wasteful expenditure, the finance minister said. “Money not spent on extravagance is money earned. We have started with a revenue deficit of Rs 16,000 crore, and there are no major revenue sources. Our government will function keeping this fact in mind. We are committed to bring down the expenditure. Chief minister Jaganmohan Reddy set the tone by going for a simple swearing-in ceremony and also for the swearing-in of the new cabinet (on June 8). This government’s main focus will be on austerity,” he asserted. He also stated that a huge amount of funds needs to be released to the state from the central government. “The previous government did not submit utilisation certificates (UCs) for which funds were not released. We are going to submit the UCs for the funds to be released,” the FM added. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP List 2019 Karnataka.description: BENGALURU: The BJP on Thursday released its first list of 21 candidates from Karnataka, but it does not include the names of sitting MP Karadi Sanganna (Koppal) or late Union minister HN Ananth Kumar’s wife Tejaswini, who is widely tipped to be the candidate from Bengaluru South. The list names the 14 other sitting MPs, including Shobha Karandlaje (Udupi-Chikkamagalur) and Suresh Angadi (Belagavi) despite stiff opposition within the party and anti-incumbency against the two. Party leaders said they are baffled by the exclusion of Tejaswini’s name and are unaware of the reasons for her candidature being withheld. “We inaugurated her personal office on Thursday and were sure of her name being announced,” one leader said. Rumours — from “technical” errors to the possibility that her name would lead to comments on “dynasty politics” — are doing the rounds. Sanganna’s candidature was withheld as the BJP is waiting for the JD(S)-Congress coalition to name its candidate. With the possibility of former chief minister Siddaramaiah contesting, the BJP will require a stronger candidate. The party also decided not to announce its candidate for Mandya, but two Congress rebels — A Manju from Hassan and Umesh Jadhav from Kalaburagi — have been given tickets. BSY has his wayThe first list confirms that the BJP central leadership continues to repose faith in state party president and Lingayat strongman BS Yeddyurappa. The list features names of his son BY Raghavendra and several confidants. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

AP BJP List 2019.description: NEW DELHI: The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP), on Thursday, announced its first candidate list for the Lok Sabha elections 2019 that includes 184 candidates. The party has named two candidates from Andhra Pradesh in the first list. Kanna Lakshminarayana will contest from Narasaraopet Lok Sabha constituency while D Purandeshwari will contest from the Visakhapatnam seat. Andhra Pradesh will go to polls in a single phase on April 11. BJP's Lok Sabha first full list The Lok Sabha elections will be held in seven phases from April 11 to May 19, 2019. The counting of the votes has been scheduled for May 23. The first phase will be held on April 11, second on April 18, third on April 23 and fourth on April 29, fifth on May 6, sixth on May 12 and seventh phase on May 19. Prime Minister Narendra Modi will contest from Varanasi constituency, while BJP president Amit Shah will fight from Gandhinagar in place of L K Advani. As many as 90 crore electors, including 1.59 crore new voters aged 18-19 years, are registered to vote in the upcoming general election. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Tejasvi Surya.description: BENGALURU: From a boy who was groomed by late Union minister H N Ananth Kumar and Tejaswini Ananth Kumar to becoming the challenge to the family’s control over Bengaluru South segment, Tejasvi Surya has come a long way.While expressing his gratitude to Kumar and his family, Surya says he is a stark example of the BJP’s intent to infuse young and new blood. You were a surprise choice for Bengaluru South. Did you expect this development?While I had feelers that there was something like this going around, I was quite happily savouring pani puri with my friends. To be honest I was overwhelmed and started tweeting about this. I only feel gratitude towards the party, which is facing a crucial election and has decided to take risk by fielding a youngster in such a prestigious seat. At 28, will you be able to fill the shoes of Kumar?Filling the shoes of Ananth Kumar is a far fetched thing for he was so gigantic. I only pray to God to give me strength, sincerity and earnestness to honestly work for the people of this constituency so that one day in the eyes of the people I can match up to Kumar’s contribution to the constituency. On lack of political experience, I have a well oiled party organisational machinery to support me with senior leaders there to hand hold me. So what is this election going to be for you?Primarily it is an election for PM Narendra Modi’s aspirational India. It is about the promise of a new and young India and I am just an ambassador of the message of this new India. It is a reflection of party and Modi’s inclination of bringing in young blood. Tejaswini not getting the ticket is quite sensitive...Yes it is sensitive but even during her talk with the Karyakartas she told them that the it was time to show maturity. She has given her full support to me. But what is your personal opinion about Tejaswini missing the ticket?When her name was first finalised by the state leadership, it must be March 11, I was the first to extend my support to her and remember posting on social media that she was the most deserving candidate and a good choice from the constituency. But the party decided to field an ordinary karyakarta like me. It is a decision taken by big people and I am just a foot soldier obeying their diktat. I have always supported Tejaswini ma’am and was literally groomed by that family. I have no reason for acrimony. Statements by Karti Chidamabaram suggest that you are the Schutzstaffel of BJP, or the infamous SS of the Nazi Germany... Your tweets also suggest that your idealogical beliefs are in conflict with the “Sab Ka Saath Sab Ka Vikas” For Karti Chidambaram and others I will reply back to them in their own coin. The idealogical inclinations are not an issue for this election. The issue for the election today, is PM Modi’s promise of a new and superpower India. My only concern as on today is to ensure that Bangalore South elects the BJP with a massive margin so that we will strengthen Modi hands. Rest is immaterial. Is age an advantage or do you require time to project yourself as a leader?That the party leadership has reposed faith in me speaks for itself and the least minimum I can do is to live up to it and say I am capable enough as on today to take on these challenges. You must rise to the occasion and I will rise to it. On dynasty politics, considering you are a nephew of a sitting BJP MLA and PM Modi has gone on the offensive against the Congress on the issue of “Naamdar”...My candidature and my role and activity in politics has no connection to my uncle’s political life. I have an identity of my own and have worked very hard over years. My aspirations precedes his elections. If the party leadership thought I was a rise to another dynast, they would not have considered me at all. Girls shine in open school class X exams.description: Vijayawada: Only 69.93% students passed the class 10 examination of the Andhra Pradesh open schools society (APOSS) while 67.82% cleared the Inter exam. While 56,149 students had appeared for the class 10 exams, 64,279 students appeared for the Inter. The results of both the exams were released on Saturday.  While girls toppled boys in the class 10 exams with a pass percentage of 73.7 (as opposed to the boys’ 67.58), boys did a little better in Inter with 67.8% passing the exam (66.45% girls passed Inter). While releasing the results, education minister Aadimulapu Suresh appreciated the results from Prakasam district which had the best numbers in the exams and asked officials from Nellore, Visakhapatnam and Kurnool to focus on improving the results. He expressed his disappointment with the Visakhapatnam coordinator for being negligent towards his duties. Suresh did this while conducting a review meeting with APOSS coordinators from 13 districts. “The open school system is to provide an opportunity for those who failed to attend regular schools. We should conduct examinations in a transparent manner without encouraging mass copying, fake candidates and other forms of malpractices,” the education minister said. Finance minister likely to take a call o.description: AMARAVATI: Finance minister Buggana Rajendranath Reddy will review the Comprehensive Financial Management System (CFMS) on Monday. CFMS, created during the TDP regime, is seen as a route to release funds to contractors without following rules. Chief secretary LV Subramanyam had directed finance department to streamline payments on a first-come-first basis instead of choice based system after taking over the reins of the state administration before the elections. But things did not follow suit. Many top officers, considered to be close to the TDP regime, were shunted to insignificant posts after Y S Jaganmohan Reddy became chief minister. Senior IAS officer Muddada Ravichandra was retained as secretary in the finance department although the government brought in S S Rawath as principal secretary. Krishnadevarayalu, a technocrat appointed as CEO of CFMS, was allowed to continue in the position. Sources said Ravichandra and Krishnadevarayalu were kept in the finance department only to assist the government to dig out past irregularities, if any. Sources said finance minister Buggana Rajendranath Reddy would take a final call on continuing CFMS after a review with top officials. Senior officials in the finance department are critical of the government decision to allow both Ravichandra and Krishnadevarayulu. Sources said the finance department had hurriedly cleared nearly Rs 200 crore bills before the new government took charge in the state. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Mamata Banerjee.description: VISAKHAPATNAM: Projecting TDP supremo and AP chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu as a “national leader of importance” and keeping the debate on the alternate front prospects in the ensuing elections alive, West Bengal chief minister and Trinamool Congress chief Mamata Banerjee appealed to people of AP to elect TDP again to keep the duo of Narendra Modi and Amit Shah away from power. “Who is Modi to ask about our Prime Minister candidate? We will decide who to elect our leader as there will be alternative for Modi,” she pointed out. Mamata said Naidu has done a lot for development of Andhra Pradesh. “It’s a necessity for AP people to give the power to Naidu again as he will play a key role in national politics and show a path of development to the entire country,” she added. Addressing a public meeting convened by TDP on Sunday, Mamata said Naidu is the leader to take the country forward. “Like he has done in Andhra Pradesh, Naidu can do a lot in Delhi,” she said. Coming down heavily on Modi, Mamata appealed the gathering to save the country and remove Modi (desh ko bachana hai to Modi ko hatao). “Modi claimed to be chaiwala after 2014 elections. Now he says he is chowkidar,” she added. “But chowkidar for whom? For those who looted the country. Modi had claimed that demonitisation would mitigate terrorism and stop black money, but ironically the number of terrorist attacks was the highest in the past two years. Under Modi’s regime, more number of farmers committed suicide and unemployment increased.” She added that Modi failed to explain the Pulawama incident and the Rafale deal and spurned the demand for an all-party meeting on the issues. “The nation does not want leaders like Narendra Modi and Amit Shah,” she asserted, and challenged Modi for an open debate on a national channel of his choice to discuss issues facing the country. Heatwave forces govt to extend half-day.description: VIJAYAWADA: The state government on Sunday issued orders extending the half-day schools in view of the prevailing heatwave conditions across the state. The half-day schools will continue for one more week till June 22. The decision was taken after the weather forecast given by Andhra Pradesh State Disaster management Authority (APSDMA) that severe heatwave conditions likely to prevail across the state because of slow progression of south west monsoon. The school education department directed to conduct half-day schools after the reopening of schools on June 12. All the schools in the state were directed to conduct classes from 8Am till 12:30Pm. Normal working hours of schools will be restored from June 24 according to the latest orders issued by the commissioner of school education K Sandhya Rani. The school education department directed the schools to follow the instructions scrupulously in view of the safety of the children. The district education officers have been directed to take action against the schools which do not comply with the instructions. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Senior cop backs airport security staff.description: VIJAYAWADA: After the frisking of former chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu at Gannavaram airport sparked a war of words between TDP and YSRC leaders, a senior police officer has come out in support of the security personnel at the airport. E Damodar, an inspector general (IG) rank official, who works as controller of legal metrology, issued a statement that everyone has to undergo security check other than those who were exempted by Bureau of Civil Aviation Security (BCAS) at all airports in the country. He said having worked as an SP and overlooked VIP security for 3.5 years in undivided Andhra Pradesh, he wanted to clarify the rules on Aviation Security (AVSEC). The Standards and Recommended Practices (SARPS) of Chicago Convention of International Civil Aviation Organisation (ICAO) mandate adherence to the SARPS by all member states. India, as part of ICAO needs to conform to SARPS. BCAS has also laid down categories of persons exempted from security screening and former chief ministers, even with Z category security, have not been exempted. Damodar said it was the late Jayalalithaa, former Tamil Nadu chief minister, who took up the issue with civil aviation authorities and secured exemption after she was subjected to security screening once she stepped down as chief minister. Ammavodi cash to harm govt schools, fear.description: VIJAYAWADA: Some schools in the state have already started to advertise about the Rs 15,000 benefit under the state government’s Ammavodi scheme even before the government has finalised it. The state government has announced that monetary benefit under Ammavodi will be extended to all parents who were sending their children to school whether it is a private or a government school. However, detailed guidelines of the scheme are yet to be formulated and notified. While private school managements are upbeat over the new scheme and hope that this will be attractive to parents and would increase student strength, experts and student organisations are expressing concerns over the scheme. PDF MLC KS Lakshman Rao said that the scheme in its present form will be disadvantageous to government schools in the state. He fears that if parents get benefit to support their children’s education, everyone might send their wards to private schools. “The government should give the benefit to only those who send their children to government schools,” said Lakshman Rao. State general secretary of Progressive Democratic Students Union (PDSU) A Ravi Chandra fears that the scheme in its present form will hasten the privatisation of education in the state. “The first causalties of the scheme will be the 8,000 government schools running with single teacher,” he said. Requests have been pouring in to the offices of education minister A Suresh and government advisor Ajeya Kallam to change the scheme to limit the benefit only to government schools. Jagan meets Amit Shah, reiterates demand.description: Vijayawada: Chief minister Y S Jaganmohan Reddy met Union home minister Amit Shah in New Delhi on Friday and submitted a representation seeking implementation of the promises and provisions of the AP Reorganisation Act, 2014. He made an appeal to the home minister to grant Special Category Status (SCS) to the state. He tried to convince Shah the need to give SCS for the financial health and development of the state. Later, Jaganmohan Reddy told the media that he renewed his request for SCS and explained how the state had suffered after bifurcation. He said he would again request for SCS at the NITI Aayog meeting to be held on Saturday. According to sources, the chief minister’s representation contained a detailed statement of the financial situation of the state and the need to compete with neighbouring states Telangana, Karnataka and Tamil Nadu. The report explained the need to have a capital city that could compete with Hyderabad, Bengaluru and Chennai and provide employment opportunities to the youth. He said that the state could provide jobs to the youth only if there are industries. Jaganmohan Reddy will address YSRC parliamentary party meeting on Saturday morning where he is likely to formulate the party’s role during the Parliament session, scheduled to begin on June 17. Tirumala: Devotee to donate 6kg gold orn.description: TIRUPATI: A new set of golden ''Kati-Varadha" hasthams worth Rs 2.25 crore will be added to the bountiful treasures of Lord Venkateswara at the Tirumala temple on Saturday. Thanga Durai, a cloth merchant and a devotee of Lord Venkateswara, who hails from Theni district in Tamil Nadu, will donate golden Kati-Varadha hasthams weighing nearly 6kg to the Tirumala temple. Speaking to reporters, Thanga Durai said, "I have been visiting the sacred abode of Lord Venkateswara since my childhood. A few years ago I fell sick and was on deathbed and had very little chances of survival. But when I prayed Lord Venkateswara and vowed to make several valuable offerings I was spared from death." HC pulls up DG (prisons), ex-home secy.description: Vijayawada: The high court pulled up former home secretary AR Anuradha, director general (DG), prisons, Vinay Ranjan Ray and Nellore central prison superintendent M Ravikiran for contempt of court orders and asked them to appear before the court. The contempt petition was moved after a man in Nellore jail was not released even after the court order, citing the model code of conduct. One Gani Srinivasulu was sentenced for life in a case. His brother Gani Pavan Kumar approached the government that Srinivasulu was eligible for release according to the G.O. 8 issued on January 23, 2018 issued by the government. However, the officials did not agree to release Srinivasulu under G.O. 8 citing that he was not eligible to be considered for mercy. Pavan Kumar moved the high court challenging the decision and the high court after considering G.O 8 and previous judgments into consideration ordered to release Srinivasulu on April 9, 2019. This time the officials did not release Srinivasulu, saying the model code of conduct is in force. Pavan Kumar again moved the high court this time with a contempt petition making home secretary A R Anuradha, director general of jails Vinay Ranjan Ray and Nellore prison superintendent M Ravikumar as respondents. Manohar Reddy, the counsel who appeared for the petitioner, argued that the officials refusing to release Srinivasulu, citing model code of conduct is nothing but defying the orders of the high court. He said they moved the high court after the officials did not respond to legal notices issued. The high court bench headed by Chief Justice C Praveen Kumar and M Satyanarayanamurty took a serious note of the issue and questioned how the model code of conduct was applicable to an order issued by the high court. The bench ordered the officials to explain why they should not take action for contempt of court orders. The court ordered to release Srinivasulu by Friday afternoon and asked the officials to attend the court to give explanation. The matter is posted for further hearing after four weeks. Chandrababu Naidu.description: KURNOOL: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday launched a blistering attack on Andhra Pradesh chief minister and erstwhile ally N Chandrababu Naidu, calling him 'u-turn Babu', whose "intent" was not on state's development. Addressing a well-attended election rally here, he sought to reject Naidu's repeated attacks that his government neglected the state. Andhra Pradesh goes to siumultaneous elections to the 175-member assembly and 25 Lok Sabha seats in the first phase on April 11 with the BJP contesting them alone. Listing various initiatives taken by the NDA government for Andhra Pradesh, Modi said it was during his regime that the Vizag-Chennai industrial corridor was flagged off and approval for the first National Institute of Ocean Technology (NIOT) given. It was also the 'chowkidar' who cleared the first Indian Institute of Packaging (IIP) besides approving the greenfield petrochemical complex for the state, he said. "Five years ago, your one vote made me PM. Your Pradhan sewak worked selflessly day and night for the people of the country. Chowkidar kept the interest of the state in mind," he said. Modi also recalled that the NDA government sanctioned first central university in Anantpur. He accused Naidu, the Telugu Desam Party supremo, of pasting state government 'stickers' on the Central schemes. "For sure, I could have done more work. I just required the cooperation of the state government. I made all efforts from my side, but the person who is running the government (Naidu), his intention is not Andhra Pradesh's development," Modi said. Levelling charges of corruption and dynasty politics against Naidu, he said the election date of April 11 will usher in the "double engine" of the state's growth -- a BJP government both at the Centre and the state. There was debate going on in AP that there were 'schemes for corruption,' ranging from the creation of the new capital Amravati, the Prime Minister charged. "The people of Andhra Pradhesh know whose coffers are being filled.. when this chowkidar sought accounts, u-turn Babu took a u-turn from AP's growth and walked out from NDA," Modi lashed out. Naidu had snapped ties with the NDA in March last year, accusing the Centre of not honouring the "promised" special category status to Andhra Pradesh. Hitting out at the TDP supremo for getting close to the Congress, Modi said Naidu has "found friends who are on bail," apparently referring to Congress leaders Rahul Gandhi and Sonia Gandhi who are on bail in the National Herald case. Modi, who had in the past hit out at Naidu for alleged family politics, said the election should also see the "son set", and called for a new "sun rise." He deliberately stressed on the "son" part to drive home his point on dynasty politics targeting the AP chief minister and his son and state minister Nara Lokesh. Without elaborating, Modi mocked that Pakistan has now accepted Naidu's "friends" as "hero." Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Nagpur BJP Candidate List.description: NAGPUR: After deadline for withdrawal for the first phase of Lok Sabha polls, 31 out of 147 candidates, whose nomination papers were found valid in seven constituencies of Vidarbha, have withdrew their papers. Now, 116 candidates are in the election fray, according chief electoral officer. Those remaining in the fray across seven constituencies are — Wardha – 14, Ramtek – 16, Nagpur – 30, Bhandara-Gondia – 14, Chandrapur – 13, Yavatmal-Washim – 24 and Gadchiroli-Chimur – 5. BJP leaders in Bhandara-Gondia are heaving a sigh of relief as two of the four rebels, Khushal Bopche and Prakash Malgave, have withdrawn from the fray after hours of persuasion by them. However, Rajendra Patle is still in the fray. Virendra Jaiswal, who resigned from BJP before nominations, is not being considered rebel as he contests every time. BJP’s Sunil Mendhe is pitted against Nana Panchbudhe of NCP here. Bopche’s rebellion had created panic in the BJP camp as he is popular in the Pawar community and in general among OBCs. In Nagpur, Abdul Karim Patel and Ravikant Meshram, withdrew on Thursday, taking the total number to three. Pallavi Nandeshwar had withdrawn on Wednesday. In Ramtek, Sachin Shende, Gajanan Jambhulkar, Prakash Tembhurne, Ranjit Saphelkar and Lalit Shamkuwar have opted out of the race. In Yavatmal-Washim and Wardha, seven and two candidates respectively withdrew on the final day. One independent candidate withdrew his nomination in Gadchiroli-Chimur constituency on Thursday. (With inputs from TO Abraham & Balwant Dhage) Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Satta King 2019.description: NEW DELHI: Satta Matka is a form of gambling or lottery that had originated before the Independence of India.Originally, the game of Matka gambling involved betting on the opening and closing rates of cotton as transmitted to the Bombay Cotton Exchange from the New York Cotton Exchange, via teleprinters.The modern-day Matka gambling/ Satta King is based on random number selection and betting. The players participating in the Satta Matka game/ gambling are required to choose the right number for winning the game. The player who wins the game becomes Satta King and is rewarded financially. Two of the most famous Matka games are - Kalyan and Worli. The Kalyan Matka gambling was started by Kalyanji Bhagat, a farmer from Gujarat, in 1962 and it ran for all days of the week. Another Matka gambling, New Worli Matka, was started by the Rattan Khatri in 1964 with slight modifications to the rules of the game. Khatri’s Matka ran only five days a week, from Monday to Friday.The modern Matka business is centred around Maharashtra.Some of the terms used in the game and their meaning is given below:    Term Meaning   Matka Matka means earthen pot that were used to draw numbers   Single Any digit between 0 and 9   Jodi/Pair Any pair of two digits between 00 and 99    Patti/Panna Three digit number    Open result / close result Outcome of matka betting   Berij Berij is last digit of jodi's/pair's sum The Google 2018 trends data shows that 'satta' and 'matka' were the top searched words in the Madhya Pradesh state in the year 2018. As per the Google data, 'satta' was the 4th most searched word with a score of 36 and 'matka' came 6th with a score of 23.Any form of Satta Matka gambling is illegal in India.Disclaimer: This content is for reference purpose only and The Times of India claims no ownership of this content. The Times of India does not support or promote piracy in any manner.Download The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

Downsizing of liquor shops not to affect.description: VIJAYAWADA: Even as the government is mulling to downsize the number of wine shops by 20% across the state as a first step in achieving prohibition, excise revenue is likely to be unaffected in the first year. As the government is considering to increase liquor prices to make it unaffordable, margin on liquor sales is likely to be increased compensating the corresponding losses in volumes, according to reliable sources in the excise department. The state government is earning nearly Rs 7,000 crore revenue on liquor sales with an average 16 per cent year-on-year growth. There are about 4,402 wine shops and 826 bars across the state which do retail liquor sales. On the other hand, each wine shop is having eight to 10 belt shops which do illegal sales of liquor especially in rural and sub-urban areas. Now with the new government taking the decision to eradicate all belt shops and also to downsize the number of liquor outlets, the sales volumes are likely to get affected. However, this reduction in number of shops may not affect revenues in the first year, said a senior official on condition of anonymity. As the liquor policy is likely to be tweaked every year to downsize the number of outlets to impose complete liquor ban in next five years, revenues will come down from the second year. The increase in liquor prices, however, will give a one-year window for the government to compensate revenue loss and look for alternative sources. On the other hand, many liquor shop owners are also looking to come out of the trade as the state government’s decision is not favourable to them as they expect tighter norms in the upcoming policy. With the reduction of margins in the previous policy, many of them had ended up in losses. Some who are in the trade for long are also not interested this time to participate in the bidding, said Y Srikanth who runs a bar in Vijayawada. New policy to make AP a dry state: Excis.description: VIJAYAWADA: The new liquor policy being formulated by the government will lead to complete luquor ban in the state. The plan will be finalised by chief minister Jaganmohan Reddy in the next ten days. This was revelaed by minister for excise and commercial taxes K Narayana Swamy in a meeting with district excise heads. Narayana Swamy said the aim of the meeting was to discuss the recurrent problems faced by the ground-level staff of excise department. “Though the new policy will take some time, we have initiated the process of liquor prohibition with the eradication of belt shops,” the minister pointed out. Narayana Swamy went on to say that the previous government had made false claims over eradication of belt shops and that TDP leaders had gained from flourishing belt shops. Another menace that the excise department is focusing on is that of arrack brewing, rampant in the two Godavari districts, agency areas and the areas sharing border with other states. The present liquor policy will expire by the end of June and new policy should be notified from July 1. The minister hinted that the new policy may downsize the number of liquor shops. He appealed to everyone to support the cause of complete liquor prohibition. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Bhaskar Reddy new TUDA head.description: TIRUPATI: Chandragiri YSRC legislator Dr Chevireddy Bhaskar Reddy took charge as the chairman of Tirupati urban development authority (TUDA) on Sunday. Tirupati MLA Bhumana Karunakar Reddy felicitated the new chairman and appealed to him to strive for the overall development of TUDA. The new chairman vowed to preserve the sanctity of the temple city in line with the sentiments of the visiting devotees and the locals alike. ‘‘Our top priority will be to provide clean water to all. We have a vision document and we will deliver the best of services to the citizens in a transparent manner,” he added. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Will not allow defections, says CM Jagan.description: VIJAYAWADA: Coming out strongly against defections, and in a fresh broadside against TDP chief Chandrababu Naidu, AP chief minister Jaganmohan Reddy on Thursday said that as long as he was the CM he would not encourage it. “I want the Opposition to be strong. I know there are some TDP MLAs who are in contact with us. But I have great respect for democracy. I won’t do what Chandrababu Naidu did in the last five years. There should be some difference. I am not Naidu to take MLAs from the Opposition without respecting the anti-defection law,” Jagan said in his speech after the election of Tammineni Sitaram as Speaker. Addressing the assembly, he said, “There will be no defections in the assembly without the members quitting their seats. Some of my leaders had suggested that I take at least five MLAs from the TDP so that Naidu does not get the position of the leader of the Opposition. But I said no. It’s against my principles. If anyone wants to join us, they should quit their post, which they hold in TDP or any other party.” Referring to the assembly, he said the same House had earlier destroyed democracy by not taking any action against defectors. “This House has seen 23 members defecting from the YSR Congress to the ruling TDP. Four of them were made ministers. The then Speaker did not take action against the defectors. The Speaker also turned undemocratic while denying the rights of the Opposition,” the AP CM said. “We have seen the ruling party purchase 23 MLAs like sheep in the market. We have seen the leader of the House (chief minister) make four of them ministers. We have seen the speaker not disqualifying those MLAs. Democracy was killed. That will not happen in my term as leader of the House. If any such MLA defects from one party to the other, you (Speaker) can disqualify such an MLA,” Jaganmohan added He further said that he will not allow undemocratic activities in the assembly. Addressing the Speaker, Jagan said, “The country should look up to Andhra Pradesh when it comes to conducting business of the House. I am sure that your long experience will help protect the values of democracy and the conventions of the House.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Now, Andhra Pradesh to have women\u2019s.description: VIJAYAWADA: Andhra Pradesh will get an exclusive women battalion soon, home minister Mekathoti Sucharitha said on Sunday.  The state government is mulling to raise four additional battalions as there is provision in the AP State Reorganisation Act, 2014. Out of the four battalions, the state government is considering to raise one women battalion and one tribal battalion. Assam, Nagaland and Jammu and Kashmir have women battalion. AP will now join the exclusive club. The Central Reserve Police Force also have women battalions. While Telangana raised four battalions after the state bifurcation, Andhra Pradesh did not utilise the provision. Each battalion will have about 1,000 personnel. Speaking to TOI, director-general of police (DGP), Gautam Sawang said the Union government will support AP in raising the new battalions. It will provide infrastructure and monetary support to the state. Having women battalion will not only increase women representation in the police department but also helps in dealing with women issues, he said. Sucharitha on Sunday said safety of women is going to be top priority for them. She said a toll free number will be launched soon for women. She said introduction of toll free number is one among the slew of measu res going to be launched.  She also announced that the government will issue notification soon to fill all vacancies in the police department. Earlier, Sucharita assumed office in the second block of Andhra Pradesh secretariat at Velagapudi near here on Sunday. She signed the file clearing medical reimbursement for constables as her first file after taking the charge. She said welfare of police personnel will be taken care of in YSRC government. “All police personnel in the state will get one weekly off like other employees. The process in this regard has already begun and we will implement weekly off to cops very shortly” she said. Sucharita observed that there is an urgent need to work towards curbing crimes against women and children.  Making a reference to Tadipatri pastor incident, Sucharita said she received a call from the girl’s mother. She complained how her daughter was subjected to sexual abuse by the pastor. “I have directed the cops take immediate action and they have booked the pastor and arrested him in less than two days. All complaints pertaining to crimes against women and children will be dealt in the same manner,” she said. The results of 2018 police recruitment drive will be announced shortly, she said adding that the notification for remaining vacancies in the department will also be issued. She said friendly policing initiatives will be launched soon. All police personnel in the state will get one weekly off like other employees. The process in this regard has already begun and we will implement weekly offs shortly. All crimes against women and children will be dealt speedily Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

RTA seizes 125 unfit school buses.description: Vijayawada: As many as 152 cases were booked against unfit school buses on Friday and 125 buses seized in a crackdown by the transport department. Data released by the transport department shows that more than 40 per cent of the vehicles that run for educational institutions in the city are yet to take fitness certificates. This comes even as the government speaks of a zero tolerance attitude towards violations in school vehicles. Transport department reports show that of the 26,898 vehicles that have been running for educational institutions till the last academic year, only 16,044 vehicles got their certificates renewed. District-wise data suggests that both the Godavari districts and Guntur have highest number of buses running without fitness certificates. On the other hand, Vizianagaram and Srikakulam are having the least number of unfit vehicles. Taking a serious note of this, transport minister Perni Venkatramaiah (Nani) had directed officials to take stern action against the violators. He had issued an ultimatum to school managements setting Thursday evening as a deadline to get fitness certificates for the buses. He had said that buses would be seized if seen on the road past the deadline. On Friday, offices of the road transport authority were flooded with applications from educational institutions. Speaking to TOI, joint commissioner of transport SAV Prasad Rao pointed out, “we received many applications on Thursday and Friday. We have had to depute additional employees to clear the rush.” Prasad Rao, however, clarified that though the number of vehicles without fitness certificates seems to be alarming, this is only indicative and does not necessarily mean that they are actually plying with students without having road fitness. He said the data was pulled up to alert the officials across the state to be vigilant and make sure that all educational vehicles running for educational institutions adhere to the norms. “Once the fitness certificate expires, no vehicle is allowed to ply on roads and if any such vehicle is found, we will initiate criminal proceedings against those responsible,” he said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Two smugglers held, 13 red sanders logs.description: TIRUPATI: Two smugglers were arrested and 13 logs of red sanders seized in a combing operation in the Seshachalam forests near Tirupati in the early hours of Sunday. Based on inputs regarding the movement of smugglers in the Nagapatla forest range in Chandragiri mandal, sleuths of the red sanders anti-smuggling task force, led by FSO Venkata Subbaiah, took up extensive combing operations inside the forests this morning. During the operation, task force sleuths spotted a group of around 14 smugglers around the forest area near Cheekateegalakona under Nagapatla forest range. As the task force sleuths got near them, the smugglers tried to escape. While several managed to flee, the task force sleuths took two smugglers into their custody at the spot. The arrested were identified as Vengeyan and Kumar who hail from hamlets in Vellore and Tiruvannamalai districts in Tamil Nadu. Task force sleuths seized 13 ‘A’-grade red sanders logs from the spot. Govt readies to supply nine-hour free po.description: VIJAYAWADA: The Andhra Pradesh government has geared up with Rs 1,700 crore infrastructure to ensure uninterrupted free power for nine hours to the farm sector. Stating that farmers’ welfare is the highest priority for the government, chief minister YS Jaganmohan Reddy has directed officials to work out modalities and make foolproof arrangements to provide nine hours of free power daily for agriculture sector during day time. According to energy minister B Srinivasa Reddy, power utilities are preparing modalities to begin the prestigious scheme. The state has 18.15 lakh pumpsets and 6,663 agriculture feeders. Of them, 4,951 feeders are ready for the nine-hour scheme. Keeping in view Tuesday’s meeting on the modalities of the nine-hour supply, the minister held a teleconference on Sunday. The state has proposed tariffs at Rs 1.50 a unit for aqua farmers, free power to SC, ST colonies up to 200 units a month, and Rs 12,500 to each farmer towards input cost. He said several states had followed the system introduced by former chief minister YS Rajasekhar Reddy. The scheme had been diluted later. Now, Jaganmohan Reddy wants to strictly implement the free power scheme and stop crop losses due to interruptions in power supply to borewells. The CM will directly contact farmers in future to know the ground reality on the nine-hour power supply” Srinivasa Reddy said. After the review of the power sector on Tuesday, a report will be submitted to the chief minister. Energy secretary and Transco chairman and managing director N Srikant said of the 6,663 agricultural 11 KV feeders in rural areas, only 1,712 feeders require some additional infrastructure to begin the nine-hour power supply during day time. Erection of 16 extra high-tension substations, 32 capacitor banks, 52 power transformers and 112 km of extra high voltage lines 220 KV should be completed to make these feeders ready. These balance 26% agriculture feeders will also be given nine hours supply in two spells (five hours during day time and four hours in night) until they are ready with full infrastructure. When officials informed about the pending loan amount of Rs 3,700 crore approved by the World Bank to improve infrastructure under Power for All scheme, the minister told them the matter would be brought to the notice of the chief minister. B Sreedhar, managing director, APGenco, said it has installed capacity of over 5213 MW. All measures have been taken to optimise the generation capacity of APGenco keeping in view the abnormal increase in demand. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Cases booked against SPFs, devotee in Al.description: Tirupati: Tirumala police booked cases against special protection forces personnel and one Dilli Babu, a devotee from Tamil Nadu, late on Friday night in the Alipiri incident, after the TTD’s vigilance and security wing recommended shifting of the SPFs responsible for manhandling the devotee. Tirumala II town inspector, Y Venkateswarulu, told TOI that cases were booked against both on the basis of complaints lodged by the SPF police and the group of devotees. “The incident happened because of communication gap and language barrier. We analysed CCTV footages and recorded statements. Based on the complaints, cases were booked against the devotee as well. But we have not detained them and even allowed them to leave for their home town on humanitarian grounds,” added the inspector. It may be recalled that Dilli Babu was thrashed by SPF cops at Alipiri check-point following an altercation after they tried to seize prohibited tobacco products from him on Thursday. After a video of the beating went viral, the TTD top brass ordered a probe into the incident and subsequently shifted the SPF cops to non-focal points, besides recommending disciplinary action against them. Meanwhile, Bharatiya Janata Party leaders have strongly condemned the incident. A group of leaders led by former TTD trust board member G Bhanu Prakash Reddy met Tirumala police and asked them to book cases against the cops, not the devotee. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Andhra Pradesh: Half-day run for schools.description: VIJAYAWADA: Owing to continuing heatwave conditions in the state, the state government on Sunday issued orders saying that schools will continue their half-day sessions till June 22. Regular hours of the schools will be restored from June 24, according to the latest orders issued by commissioner of school education K Sandhya Rani. The decision was taken after the forecast made by the Andhra Pradesh state disaster management authority (APSDMA) that severe heatwave conditions will prevail across the state of AP for some days now because of the slow progression of south-west monsoon. The school education department had ordered conducting half-day schools after reopening of schools on June 12. All schools in the state were directed to conduct classes from 8am to 12:30pm. Schools in the state have been ordered to follow the instructions in view of the safety of the children. District education officers have been directed by the government to take action against the schools which do not comply with the instructions. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Tejashwi Yadav.description: PATNA/ BHAGALPUR: RJD chief Lalu Prasad’s younger son and leader of opposition in Bihar legislative assembly Tejashwi Prasad Yadav kicked off the Lok Sabha election campaign on Monday by addressing public meetings at Gaya, Banka and Bhagalpur in support of the Mahagathbandhan candidates. Close aides of Tejashwi said he is expected to address around 200 election meetings across the state over the next two months. “Tejashwi is the face of RJD and the star campaigner of Mahagathbandhan. He will be canvassing for candidates of all the Mahagathbandhan constituents — RJD, Congress, RLSP, HAM(S) and VIP. Thus, he will be addressing three to four election meetings every day,” Tejashwi’s political adviser Sanjay Yadav told TOI on Monday. Canvassing for RJD candidate Shailesh Kumar alias Bulo Mandal from Bhagalpur, Tejashwi came down heavily on NDA governments at the Centre and in state. He accused PM Narendra Modi of making false promises and propaganda to win the 2014 general election. “It won’t be repeated in the ensuing Lok Sabha elections,” Tejashwi said while raising questions about employment scenario and issues of Vijay Malaya, Nirav Modi, Mehul Chowksi and others who fled the country after swindling money from banks in India. Criticizing Nitish for snapping ties with RJD in 2017, Tejashwi said there was acute shortage of fertilizers, while the health services were also in a poor state. He accused deputy CM Sushil Kumar Modi of protecting those involved in the multi-crore Srijan scam in Bhagalpur and some other districts. Urging the audience to vote for the RJD candidate, Tejashwi said the Bhagalpur voters had showed a mirror to Modi by voting for RJD in 2014. “They should do the same this election as the NDA government stands exposed,” he said. Political observers feel Tejashwi has become a good orator, especially after coming out of power in July 2017 when CM Nitish Kumar snapped ties with RJD-led Mahagathbandhan and rejoined BJP-led NDA. “Though not as good as his father in terms of having a rustic touch, Tejashwi is a good orator in terms of eloquence,” said DM Diwakar, political observer and professor at AN Sinha Institute of Social Studies. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Maharashtra Lok Sabha Constituencies.description: MUMBAI: Maharashtra, which has 48 parliamentary constituencies, will go to polls in four phases, starting April 11. In 2009 and 2014, Lok Sabha elections were held in three phases in Maharashtra On April 11, seven constituencies in Maharashtra’s Vidarbha region will go to polls - Nagpur, Wardha, Yavatmal-Washim, and the naxal-affected areas of Gadchiroli and Chandrapur. In the second phase on April 18, 10 constituencies - including three constituencies in Vidarbha, six in Marathwada and Solapur in western Maharashtra - go to elections. The third phase, on April 23, of polling will be held in Pune, Baramati, Jalgaon, Jalna, Aurangabad, Raigad and Ratnagiri-Sindhudurg, Sangli, Satara and Kolhapur. In the final phase on April 29, all six constituencies in Mumbai, Thane, Kalyan, Palghar and Bhiwandi will go to polls among the total 17 seats in the state. KEY CONSTITUENCIESAmong the key constituencies are Baramati and Nagpur featuring high-profile candidates such as Supriya Sule and Nitin Gadkari. Then there is Ahmednagar from where Sujay Vikhe Patil, son of senior Congress leader Radhakrishna Vikhe Patil, is contesting. Other important constituencies are Jalna, Chandrapur, Dhule, Beed, Sangli, Mumbai North Central, Mumbai North and Baramati.    CONSTITUENCIES CONTENDERS   Chandrapur Union MoS Hansraj Ahir (BJP); Suresh Dhanorkar (Congress)   Baramati Kanchan Kul (BJP); Supriya Sule (Congress)   Jalna State BJP chief Raosaheb Danve BJP; Vilas Keshavrao Autade (Congress)   Akola Sanjay Dhotre (BJP); Hidayat Patel (Congress)   Bhiwandi Kapil Patil(BJP); Suresh Kashinath Taware (Congress)    Nagpur Union minister Nitin Gadkari (BJP)   Ahmednagar Sujay Vikhe Patil (BJP)   Dhule Union MoS for defence Subash Bhamre (BJP)    Beed Late BJP MP Gopinath Munde’s daughter Pritam (BJP); Bajrang Sonawane (NCP)   Sangli Sitting MP Sanjay Patil (BJP)    Mumbai North Central Poonam Mahajan (BJP)    Aurangabad Subhash Zambad (Congress)   Gadchiroli Ashok Nete (BJP)   Mumbai North Gopal Shetty (BJP)    Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Raids continue, 26 unfit buses taken off.description: Vijayawada: As many as 99 cases were booked and 26 buses seized across the state on Saturday as the transport department’s crackdown continued against errant vehicles of educational institutions. As many as 265 cases have been booked so far across the state.In Krishna district, deputy transport commissioner E Meera Prasad participated in the raids on Saturday morning. Meera Prasad said that apart from having fitness certificates, school buses should adhere to other prescribed norms as well. “We have been checking for other essentials like fire extinguishers, first aid boxes and racks to place books.” Another important aspect that schools should ensure is that all bus drivers should be less than 60 years old. “Schools should also conduct medical check-ups on the drivers once in every three months and the medical reports should be submitted in the parent-teacher meeting,” Meera Prasad pointed out, adding that it is essential to send the designated driver on duty. “Others should not be allowed even if they are qualified,” he said. Meera Prasad further said that the raids will continue in future and vehicles should always be ready to face tests. In Guntur, DTC Rajaratnam participated in the drive and booked seven cases on Saturday, seizing 22 buses so far. Transport department had started the raids since schools re-opened across the state. Since more than 40 per cent of school buses have not renewed their fitness certificates by going through mandatory tests, the transport department took a serious note of the issue. The government has also directed officials to take stringent action against the errant schools. Transport minister Perni Venkatramaiah (Nani) ordered to implement the rules to ensure safety of the students. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Rowdy-sheeter knifed to death.description: VIJAYAWADA: A 32-year-old rowdy-sheeter was stabbed to death by two persons on CVR flyover in Vijayawada on the intervening night of Saturday and Sunday. The deceased, identified as Kilari Suresh, was a native of Chitti Nagar. According to Mohammed Umar, inspector of Two Town police station, the murder was carried out around midnight. Suresh stopped an auto on CVR flyover and demanded money from the driver and his friend (who also is an auto driver by vocation). As the two men refused to give him money, Suresh took out a knife and threatened to attack them. Police said that all the three men involved in the incident were in an inebriated state. As Suresh threatened the two friends with his knife, the auto drivers retaliated and attacked him. They snatched the knife from Suresh’s hand and inflicted deep gashes upon him with the knife. Suresh died on the spot with heavy bleeding. Upon knowing about the incident, cops rushed to the spot and shifted the body to a government hospital. Suresh was a habitual offender and drinker. He often used threats to extort money in an inebriated state at Wynchpet and Chitti Nagar areas. He has a rowdy sheet against him at Two Town police station and many pending cases. On the other hand, the auto drivers are said to be natives of YSRC Colony and they do not have any criminal background, according to police sources. Cops are yet to make arrests in the case. Post-Kolkata incident, Andhra Pradesh do.description: VIJAYAWADA: Indian Medical Association (IMA), Vijayawada, president Dr TV Ramana Murthy has urged CM YS Jaganmohan Reddy to bring out stringent laws against attacks on medicare professionals in the state on Friday. Addressing a press conference, he expressed solidarity with the doctors who were assaulted by an 85-year-old patient’s family in NRSMC Kolkata recently. “In Andhra Pradesh, since former CM YS Rajasekhara Reddy had passed Act number 11 of 2008 for prevention of violence against doctors which has not been implemented properly. We request our present chief minister Jaganmohan Reddy to ensure its implementation,” Ramana Murthy said addressing a room full of media. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BSP List 2019 UP.description: LUCKNOW: The BSP on Friday announced its first list of 11 candidates for the Lok Sabha elections 2019, fielding JD(S) turncoat Kunwar Danish Ali from Amroha. Ali, who was general secretary of the Janata Dal-Secular, quit the party and joined the Bahujan Samaj Party only last week. The BSP also declared Haji Fazulrahman its nominee from Saharanpur, Malook Nagar from Bijnore and Girish Chandra from Nagina, a party release said. Hazi Mohammad Yakoob has been fielded from Meerut, Satbeer Nagar from Gautam Buddh Nagar, Yogesh Verma from Bulandshahr, Ajit Baliyan from Aligarh, Manoj Kumar Soni from Agra, Rajveer Singh from Fatehpur Sikri and Ruchi Veera from Aonla. Mayawati's BSP is contesting 38 of the 80 Lok Sabha constituencies in Uttar Pradesh under the seat-sharing arrangement with Samajwadi Party and the Rashtriya Lok Dal. Satta Matka 2018.description: AGRA: Shyam Vohra, known as 'satta king' of the Taj city, was denied bail by district court of Agra. Vohra, who was arrested by the Agra police in July for his alleged involvement in betting on FIFA World Cup matches. Earlier, in April, Vohra was arrested by the Nodia STF from Greater Noida for placing bets on IPL matches, but he was granted bail. After Vohra’s arrest, Agra police booked him and his known associates including his son Vatsal, wife Rakhi, nephew Prateek, brother-in-law Kaushal and others for their alleged involvement in betting. On Monday, judge Anil Kumar Pundhir rejected Vohra’s bail plea, who was charged for attempt to murder, as he allegedly opened fire on policemen. Further, Vohra was charged for running illegal gambling racket, criminal conspiracy and obstructing policemen from executing their duties. Police are yet to arrest the relatives and associates of Vohra. Several years back, Vohra had gain notoriety for betting on cricket matches. In April, during IPL matches, the gambling racket run by Vohra had deposited Rs 62 lakh in 10 banks, after which police approached banks to freeze the amount. Even during the FIFA World Cup, Vohra collected huge amount of cash through betting. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Jagan\u2019s Amma Vodi to begin from Jan.description: GUNTUR: Chief minister and YSR Congress supremo YS Jaganmohan Reddy on Friday assured that the financial assistance under Amma Vodi scheme would be extended to all those parents who send their wards to any schools. Jagan was addressing a public meeting organized as part of Rajanna Badi Bata at Tadepalli ZP high school. Stating he wanted to see every child from the state going to school, Jagan asserted that his government would disburse the guaranteed Rs 15,000 financial assistance to the mother of every school-going child on next January 26 next year. “You send the children to any school of your choice. We will grant financial assistance as the children are deserved to pursue their dreams” promised Jagan. “English medium will be introduced in all the government schools and Telugu will be made mandatory to protect the Telugu language,” he said. Handing some relief to the parents, Jagan promised to make efforts to curb down the astronomical fees being collected by the corporate educational institutions. “I have personally seen the struggle of the parents in sending their wards to the private schools by paying huge fees during my padayatra. Many of the government schools are in a dilapidated condition which the parents might not prefer opting for their children to pursue studies. At the same time, they are unable to afford mind-boggling fees being collected by the corporate schools. So I have decided to give financial assistance to reduce the burden on such poor parents,” Jagan said. He, also said that they would not leave the government schools in the shoddy state as they were readying an action plan to revamp all the schools and promised to revolutionise the public education system in next two years. “There were about 40,000 government schools in Andhra and we will change their fate in two years. Send us pictures of the government schools and we will show you how they will be after two years,” he asserted. Shedding light of the high illiteracy rate in Andhra Pradesh, Jagan said, “The illiteracy rate in AP is at 33% which is almost 7% higher than the national average of 27%. The poor infrastructure in the public schools, non-supply of textbooks are also the reason for the high illiteracy rate in the state. Many schools don’t even have proper toilets and drinking water facilities. Moreover, the previous government deliberately neglected government schools to promote private schools and colleges.” “Our government is committed to changing this scenario with a slew of programmes and we will show the change with visual evidence,” he asserted. Parliament Session.description: NEW DELHI: The first session of the 17th Lok Sabha will commence from Monday during which the passage of the Union Budget and other key legislations such as triple talaq will be on top of the agenda for the government. Prime Minister Narendra Modi, chairing an all-party meeting on the eve of the first session of the new Lok Sabha, invited heads of all parties to a meeting on June 19 to discuss the "one nation, one election" issue and other important matters. Noting that there are many new faces in this Lok Sabha, PM Modi said the first session of the lower house of Parliament should begin with "fresh zeal and new thinking". At the all-party meeting, the Congress raised with the government issues of unemployment, farmers distress, drought, and press freedom, while also calling for early conduct of assembly polls in Jammu and Kashmir. The opposition parties demanded discussion on all such issues in Parliament, with the Congress asserting that it is still a "fight of ideologies". Prime Minister Modi, defence minister Rajnath Singh, leader of opposition in the Rajya Sabha Ghulam Nabi Azad, Congress lawmakers Adhir Ranjan Choudhary, K Suresh, National Conference leader Farooq Abdullah and TMC leader Derek O'Brien were present at the meeting. The BJP also held its parliamentary party meet on Sunday with Prime Minister Modi assuring Indians that his government will be at the forefront of facilitating legislation that manifests the spirit of "sabka saath, sabka vikas, sabka vishwas". A day before the first session of the newly-constituted 17th Lok Sabha, a meeting of the NDA was also held here. The government had promulgated as many as 10 ordinances for the session which ends on July 26 and will have 30 sittings. The first two days of the session will be used for administering oath of office to all Lok Sabha MPs. The oath will be administered by protem Speaker Virender Kumar. The Speaker will be elected on June 19 and the next day the President will address a joint sitting of both Houses. The budget will be introduced on July 5. Among the bills that will be introduced, the one on triple talaq could be a contentious one between the government and the opposition. Addressing the media after the all-party meeting, parliamentary affairs minister Prahlad Joshi said the Prime Minister urged leaders of all parties to "introspect whether members of Parliament are able to fulfil people's aspirations as their representatives and the manner in which last two years of the 16th Lok Sabha were wasted". An all-party meeting is a customary procedure before the beginning of every session of Parliament to ensure its smooth functioning. Joshi said the government has requested all parties, especially the opposition, for their cooperation for the smooth functioning of both Houses of Parliament. In order to build esprit de corps, PM Modi has invited presidents of all those parties who have an MP either in Lok Sabha or Rajya Sabha for a meeting on June 19. The meeting has been called to discuss "one nation, one election" issue, celebrations of 75 years of India's Independence in 2022 and 150 years of Mahatma Gandhi's birth anniversary this year, he said. It will be followed by a dinner meeting with all MPs of both Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha on June 20 to freely interact and exchange views with the government, Joshi said, adding that these two novel initiatives would go a long way in building team spirit among all parliamentarians. In Video:First session of 17th Lok Sabha starts on June 17Download The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

Doctors strike.description: Healthcare in hospitals across the country is set for a major disruption on Monday with   Indian Medical Association   deciding to withdraw non-essential services for a day to express solidarity with their striking colleagues in Bengal. However, in a move that may bring some relief to patients in New Delhi, AIIMS resident doctors have decided not to join the strike. But those in Safdarjung Hospital, Lady Hardinge Medical College, RML Hospital and others will skip work. In Kolkata on Sunday, the agitating doctors said they were ready to meet Mamata Banerjee "anytime and anywhere". The government proposed a 3pm meeting at the state secretariat on Monday. The doctors were reportedly ready to accept the proposal. IMA strike to cripple OPDs todayEarlier, the junior doctors had insisted that the meeting cannot be held behind closed doors and the media should be allowed to telecast it live. The state government, however, cited legalities and constitutional propriety, which prevent such meetings from being held under public glare. The doctors were ready to accept the government's request, sources indicated late Sunday, which would pave the way for "across-the-table" discussions between the protesters and the chief minister. "We are very hopeful for the meeting in Nabanna (state secretariat) on Monday," a senior official, mediating for the state, said. "We have explained to them that given the issues involved, mainly legal, administrative and security-related, it is impossible for the state government to agree to their demand for an open-door meeting in presence of the media. The CM is also sworn to an oath of secrecy in some such matters. We have explained they have every right to speak to media afterwards, much like the norm in all such cases. They have agreed to it," he said. Under pressure from several quarters, including the seniors in the medical fraternity, the junior doctors in Kolkata held a four-hour general body meeting at NRS Hospital. The meeting appeared to split three ways. While a section of doctors agreed to have the meeting at Nabanna, another section stressed on Raj Bhavan as the venue, while the remaining stuck to their demand for NRS Hospital. Pressure further mounted on the striking doctors to find a solution to the standoff. At 3.30pm, a group of doctors announced their stand. "We are hopeful that our CM will be considerate enough to solve the problems that the state is facing in the healthcare sector currently," they said in a statement while refusing to accept any question from the media. "We leave the decision to choose the venue to the honourable CM, but it should accommodate representatives of all medical colleges of West Bengal in sufficient numbers," the statement read. They expressed willingness to join work, "as early as possible in the best interest of the common people once our demands are addressed". Vijayawada reeling under heatwave.description: VIJAYAWADA: Severe heatwave conditions which have prevailed in Vijayawada since the past few days has become a major cause of concern as the mercury shot to nearly 43 degree Celsius on Thursday. This has led to drastic surge in the number of heat stroke cases reported at Vijayawada Government General Hospital in the last two days. Moreover, fluctuations in the day temperature has resulted in many cases of dehydration. Temperature had touched 46 degree Celsius in the first week of May and eventually came down to nearly 38 degree Celsius in the third week of May. However, the city again witnessed rise in temperature since the first week of June. As a result of the scorching heat, city streets wore a deserted look from 10am. Krishna district administration and Vijayawada Municipal Corporation alerted health wing officials to arrange special medical teams to handle heatwave cases. Also, voluntary organisations are distributing drinking water and buttermilk to pedestrians and motorists on highways during the day. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

N Chandrababu Naidu frisked by security.description: VIJAYAWADA: Former chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu was frisked by airport security personnel at Gannavaram airport on Friday. Despite being under Z+ category security, Naidu’s vehicle was not allowed inside the airport and he was asked to go in the airport bus along with other passengers to board the plane. Naidu was flying to Hyderabad after the review meeting with party leaders over election defeat on Friday evening. Apart from the privileges of former chief minister, Naidu enjoys VVIP treatment as he is one of the senior most politician in the country. The central government provided him with Z+ category security as he is one of the main target of Maoists. The TDP leaders alleged that the police department is jeopardising the safety of Naidu by reducing his convoy and by not providing minimum privileges. TDP official spokesperson and MLC Budha Venkanna said that recently the police department withdrawn two vehicles from Naidu’s convoy and they are not allowing his vehicle inside the airport. Frisking him at the security entrance is nothing but a desperate attempt of showcasing power, he said. Read this report in MarathiDownload The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Lok Sabha Elections in Tamil Nadu.description: NEW DELHI: Tamil Nadu goes to polls in the second phase of the seven-phase elections. Elections to 39 parliamentary seats will take place on April 18 in a single-phase polling. Lok Sabha elections 2019: Get all live updatesTOP CONTENDERSThe four-cornered contest features AIADMK-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA), its chief rival DMK-led Secular Progressive Alliance (SPA), actor Kamal Haasan's Makkal Needhi Maiam and TTV Dhinakaran's Amma Makkal Munnetra Kazhagam (AMMK). This time the elections are taking place sans the Dravidian stalwarts M Karunanidhi and J Jayalalithaa. AIADMK chief Jayalalithaa passed away in December 2016 while Karunanidhi died in August 2018. While the DMK is contesting on 20 seats, the Congress is fighting elections on 9 seats in Tamil Nadu. In the AIADMK-BJP alliance, the national party will be contesting from five seats in the state while the PMK will be contesting from seven. Tamil Nadu Lok Sabha elections: Get all live updatesHOW MANY SEATS?Tamil Nadu has 39 Lok Sabha seats and one in neighbouring Puducherry. Here is the list of constituencies: Arakkonam, Arani, Chennai Central, Chennai North, Chennai South, Chidambaram(SC), Coimbatore, Cuddalore, Dharmapuri, Dindigul, Erode, Kallakurichi, Kancheepuram(SC), Kanyakumari, Karur, Krishnagiri, Madurai, Mayiladuthurai, Nagapattinam(SC), Namakkal Nilgiris(SC), Perambalur, Pollachi, Ramanathapuram, Salem, Sivaganga, Sriperumbudur, Tenkasi(SC), Thanjavur, Theni, Thiruvallur(SC), Thoothukudi, Tiruchirapalli, Tirunelveli, Tiruppur, Tiruvannamalai, Vellore, Villupuram(SC), Virudhunagar, Puducherry(Union Territory) KEY CONSTITUENCIESThe key constutuencies include Sivaganga, Chennai South, Chennai North, Chennai Central, Chidambaram(SC), Coimbatore, Cuddalore, Dharmapuri, Dindigul, Kanyakumari, Karur, Thoothukudi , Nilgiris(SC), Trichy, Vellore amd Arani. Here is a list of contituencies with prominent candiadates or clashes.
